dub.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: to give something or someone a name that describes them in some way
dub.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: The body, thousands of years old, was found in the Alps and dubbed ‘The Iceman’.
dub.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: to change the original spoken language of a film or television programme into another language
dub.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: a British film dubbed into French
dub.translation[0].definitions[1].note_b: Dub is usually passive in meanings 1 and 2
dub.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: to make a record out of two or more different pieces of music or sound mixed together
dub.translation[0].definitions[3].defini: to copy a recording from a tape or CD onto another tape
dub.translation[0].definitions[4].defini: if a king or queen dubs someone, they give the title of knight to that person in a special ceremony
dub.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: a style of poetry or music from the West Indies with a strong regular beat
